title: Contains Duplicate
description:
## Contains Duplicate

You are running a quality check on a shipment of uniquely-coded components. Each component has an integer identifier. Your task is to detect whether any identifier has been assigned more than once — a sign of a labeling error.

Given an integer array `nums`, return `true` if any value appears **at least twice** in the array, and `false` if every element is distinct.

**Constraints:**
- `1 <= nums.length <= 10^5`
- `-10^9 <= nums[i] <= 10^9`

examples.explanation: The value 1 appears at index 0 and index 3.

solutions.label: Brute Force — O(n²)
solutions.explanation: Compare every pair of elements. If any two are equal, return True immediately. Return False if no duplicates found.

solutions.label: Hash Set — O(n)
solutions.explanation: Use a hash set to track elements seen so far. For each element, if it's already in the set we found a duplicate. Otherwise add it. One pass, O(1) lookup per element.

hints: What data structure lets you check membership in O(1)?
You only need to know if something has been seen before — a set is perfect for this.
